deficiency_area_items.action: - If a test button is present, engage the test button and verify the back-up battery-powered light comes on.- If there is no test button, verify the AC-powered sign is fully lit.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If multiple signs are present, note the specific area of the impacted sign. - Some AC-powered signs may have unutilized test buttons and some back-up batteries may be remotely located.- If the back-up battery is remotely located, the POA may direct the inspector to the remote location and demonstrate its functionality. - Combination auxiliary light and exit sign devices must be recorded as two individual deficiencies, each within its respective inspectable item.

deficiency_areas.name: Fence and Gate
deficiency_areas.definition: Fence: A barrier, railing, or other upright structure to control access. Gate: A moveable barrier that closes an opening in a wall or fence.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Establish a visual boundary and provide security and controlled access.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Post; Lock; Gate; Fencing material; Hinge; Latch; Nails
deficiency_areas.more_information: - This item includes, but is not limited to, utility fencing, pool fencing, fencing around unprotected heights, storm water management pond, daycares, as well as associated gates. - This item does not include perimeter (i.e., intended to provide full or partial enclosure of a property along or near the property lines), landscape, or decorative fencing. - A single or multi-panel garage door should be evaluated under Garage Door standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fence component is missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Fence component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete), resulting in a hole that is approximately 20%% or greater of the area of a single section of fence.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at each section of the fence for missing pickets or fence portions.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Determine the approximate percentage of the section of fence impacted.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A single section of fence is the portion of fence located between two consecutive posts.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fence demonstrates signs of collapse.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Fence demonstrates signs of collapse.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for failing (e.g., rotten, eaten, rusted, cracking) fence posts that allow all or part of a fence panel to become unstable, lean, or fall.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Gate does not open, close, latch, or lock.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Gate will not open. OR Gate will open when locked or latched. OR Gate will not close.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Open the gate fully. - Close the gate fully and latch the gate. - Attempt to open the gate without engaging the latch. - Attempt to open the locked gate while engaging the latch.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the fence is enclosing a utility item with the lock owned by the utility company, then the inspector should ensure that the gate is locked. - If a lock is not present, then do not evaluate it as a deficiency under this standard. - A single or multi-panel garage door should be evaluated under Garage Door standard.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If lock is present on gate, ask the POA to unlock gate. - If a lock is present on the gate, ask the POA to lock the gate.

deficiency_areas.name: Fire Escape
deficiency_areas.definition: An apparatus on the outside of a building used for escaping from a building on fire.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provides a means of alternative emergency egress from the interior of the building to the exterior.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Stairs; Ladder; Platform; Guardrail; Handrail; A counterbalanced stairway; Drop ladder
deficiency_areas.more_information: A blocked fire escape should be evaluated under the Egress standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fire escape component is damaged or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any stair, ladder, platform, guardrail, or handrail is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). OR Any stair, ladder, platform, guardrail, or handrail is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Check the fire escape stairs, platforms, guardrails, and handrails for damage, deterioration, or any condition that renders the component unusable or unsafe to traverse. - Inspect for missing fire escape components.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If a window or door leading to the fire escape is blocked, refer to the Egress standard. - If the fire escape itself is blocked, refer to the Egress standard. - There is no requirement for inspectors to go on the fire escape as this is a visual observation from the ground or unit.

deficiency_areas.name: Fire Extinguisher
deficiency_areas.definition: A portable fire safety device that discharges a jet of water, foam, gas, or other material to extinguish a fire.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Put out a small fire by directing onto it a substance that cools the burning material, deprives the flame of oxygen, or interferes with the chemical reactions occurring in the flame.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Tank; Locking pin; Handle or operating lever; Pressure gauge; Discharge hose and nozzle; Mounting bracket; Fire extinguisher cabinet; Inspection tag
deficiency_areas.more_information: - This standard does not apply to fire extinguishers owned by the resident. - Do not evaluate fire extinguishers that are not in service (i.e., in storage or awaiting service).

deficiency_area_items.description: Fire extinguisher is damaged or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Fire extinguisher is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). OR Fire extinguisher is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look along the walls for evidence of prior installation of a fire extinguisher (e.g., brackets, signage, or marked cabinets). - If present, visually inspect to identify any damage.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: Ask the POA to identify all fire extinguishers provided by the property.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fire extinguisher pressure gauge reads over or under-charged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Pressure gauge indicates that the fire extinguisher is over or under-charged.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the fire extinguisher and determine if it has a pressure gauge. - If it does, ensure that the gauge is in the green zone and not discharged or over or under-charged.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: Ask the POA to identify all fire extinguishers provided by the property.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fire extinguisher service tag is missing, illegible, or expired.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The date on the service tag of any fire extinguisher has exceeded one year. OR The fire extinguisher tag is missing or illegible. OR A nonchargeable or disposable fire extinguisher is more than 12 years old (based on manufacture date).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at a chargeable fire extinguisher and verify the date on the service tag.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the POA provides the invoice or report from the servicing fire extinguisher company, do not record a deficiency for a missing tag. The date of the report must be no more than one year from the inspection date.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: Ask the POA to identify all fire extinguishers provided by the property.

deficiency_areas.name: Flammable and Combustible Item
deficiency_areas.definition: A combustible material is any material that, in the form in which it is used and under the conditions anticipated, will ignite and burn or will add appreciable heat to an ambient fire.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: None
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Flammable or combustible item is on or within 3 feet of an appliance that provides heat for thermal comfort or a fuel-burning water heater. OR Improperly stored chemicals.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Flammable or combustible item is on or within 3 feet of an appliance that provides heat for thermal comfort or a fuel-burning water heater. OR Improperly stored chemicals.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for flammable or combustible items on or near an appliance that provides heat for thermal comfort. - Look for flammable or combustible items on or near a fuel-burning water heater. - Look for any improperly stored chemicals (e. g., paint, gasoline, etc.).
deficiency_area_items.action: - If applicable, measure distance between the flammable or combustible item and the appliance that provides heat for thermal comfort. - If applicable, measure distance between the flammable or combustible item and the fuel-burning water heater.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Excluding heating oil in a heating oil tank, petroleum products (e.g., gasoline, kerosene, or propane) should never be stored in the Unit or Inside areas. - A combustible item in its original container and stored in a safe place (e.g., under a kitchen sink, in a hall closet, etc.) is not a deficiency. - Electrical components should not be evaluated as ignition sources under this standard.

deficiency_areas.name: Floor
deficiency_areas.definition: Lower surface of a room.
deficiency_areas.purpose: A horizontal lower surface of a room used to walk on and may separate levels.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Carpet fibers (e.g., nylon, polyester, wool); Insulation; Grout; Bonding agent; Tiles; Carpet; Hardwood flooring; Stain; Underlayment; Padding
deficiency_areas.more_information: - Within an unfinished basement, bare concrete floors are acceptable.  - Within a unit or inside location regularly utilized by a resident, then polished or painted concrete floors are acceptable. However, bare concrete floors are not acceptable within these locations.

deficiency_area_items.description: Floor substrate is exposed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: 10%% or more of the floor substrate area is exposed in any room.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look down to identify exposed substrate on any area of the floor within each room.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the exposed area within each room.  - Determine the total percentage of the exposed area within each room.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Floor component(s) is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Floor component(s) is not functionally adequate (i.e., does not allow floor to separate levels or to be walked on).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the floor to identify any component that is not functionally adequate (i.e., does not allow floor to separate levels or to be walked on).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall floor exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the  condition under the Structural System standard.  - Examples of conditions that may inhibit a floor component(s)'s functionality may include:  - Wood rot - Sloping - Deflection - Some surface abnormalities may indicate the presence of this deficiency (e.g., lifting tiles, hardwood cupping, linoleum  bubbling, etc.); however, the surface abnormalities alone do not constitute a deficiency under this standard.

deficiency_areas.name: Food Preparation
deficiency_areas.definition: Flat surface installations in kitchens or food preparation spaces.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Generally used for food preparation and is made of nonporous surfaces designed to be cleaned.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Nonporous surface; Backsplash
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Food preparation area is damaged or is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Exposed substrate surface comprises at least 10% or more of the total food preparation area.  OR  The food preparation area is not functionally adequate (i.e., does not reasonably allow for adequate preparation of food).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at food preparation area for damaged areas, delamination, or burns that would lead to exposed substrate. - If damage is visible, determine cumulative percentage of damage in which the food preparation area’s substrate is  exposed.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the exposed substrate area. - Determine if the countertop is functionally adequate to allow for food preparation purposes.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Substrate is the material under the countertop’s nonporous surface.

deficiency_areas.name: Foundation
deficiency_areas.definition: Lowest load-bearing part of a building.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provide support for a structure by transferring the structural load to the surrounding soil while also isolating the structure from ground moisture.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Foundation vent; Footing; Slab; Masonry block; Pier; Post; Tie down strap
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Foundation is cracked.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Crack is present with a width of ¼-inch or greater and a length of 12 inches or greater.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the foundation and identify if there are any indicators of foundation cracks (e.g., cracks in walls, no functioning doors, unlevel floors or windows).
deficiency_area_items.action: - If a crack is found, measure its length and width.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall foundation exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Foundation has exposed rebar or foundation is spalling, flaking, or chipping.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The structure has any exposed rebar.ORFoundation is spalling, flaking, or chipping, and the affected area is 12x12 inches or greater and goes into the foundation at a depth of ¾-inch or greater.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at a structure and examine it for any exposed rebar or spalling, flaking, or chipping in the foundation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If signs are found, measure the affected area.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall foundation exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Foundation is infiltrated by water.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence of water infiltration through the foundation.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the entire foundation for evidence of water infiltration (e.g., excessive dampness, collected water, stains, or mineral deposits). - Look for evidence of water ponding against the foundation.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Foundation support post, column, beam, or girder is damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any support post, column, or girder area is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the foundation and identify if there are any areas of damage (e.g., rot) on support posts, columns, or girders.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall foundation exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Foundation vent cover is missing or damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Foundation vent cover is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) or damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look along the exterior foundation walls for evidence of prior installation of a foundation vent cover. - If evidence of prior installation is found, determine if the vent cover is complete and undamaged.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Garage Door
deficiency_areas.definition: A large door on a garage that opens either manually or by an electric motor. Garage doors are frequently large enough to accommodate automobiles and other vehicles. Small garage doors may be constructed as a single panel that tilts up and back across the garage ceiling.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provide barrier to outside elements and provide contained storage of vehicle or personal property.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Primary door; Track; Door balance; Springs; Motor; Safety stop; Hinges; Weather seal; Opening controls; Lighting
deficiency_areas.more_information: Garage walls will be evaluated under the Wall Covering and Finish – Interior and Wall Covering and Finish – Exterior standards, respectively.

deficiency_area_items.description: Garage door has a hole.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Garage door has a hole of any size that penetrates through to the interior.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the garage door to identify any holes.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall foundation exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Garage door does not open, close, or remain open or closed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Door will not open and remain open. OR Door will not close and remain closed.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if the garage door can be opened manually or electronically.
deficiency_area_items.action: Manual Door:- Open the door manually. - Verify the door remains open. - Manually close the door. - Verify the door remains closed. Electronic Door:- Use remote, keypad, or switch to open the door electronically. - Verify the door remains open.- Use remote, keypad, or switch to close the door. - Verify nothing is in the path of the sensors. - Verify the door remains closed.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Guardrail
deficiency_areas.definition: A barrier along an open, raised walking surface.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Protect from fall hazards along balconies, stairs, ramps, decks, rooftops, hallways, retaining walls, and other walking surfaces.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Railing; Post; Top rail; Mid rail; Vertical rail; Baluster; Anchors; Brackets
deficiency_areas.more_information: - A retaining wall that is not adjacent to a walking surface should not be evaluated under this standard. - A retaining wall that is adjacent to a walking surface (e.g., patio, sidewalk) should be evaluated under this standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Guardrail is missing or not installed.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The guardrail is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete) or not installed (i.e., never installed, but should have been) along a walking surface that is more than 30 inches above the floor or grade below.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify any elevated walking surfaces. - If the vertical distance measures more than 30 inches above the floor or grade below, verify if the guardrail is present. - If not present, look for evidence of a previously installed guardrail that is now missing or incomplete.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If present, measure the vertical distance between the elevated walking surface and the floor or grade below.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - This deficiency should only be evaluated in areas that are accessible to the resident.

deficiency_area_items.description: Grab bar is not secure.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any movement whatsoever is detected in the grab bar.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - If present, grab the bar in the middle and apply moderate force back and forth.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Guardrail is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Guardrail is missing functional component(s) (i.e., a component that is critical to the guardrail protecting from fall hazards).ORGuardrail is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).OR Guardrail is less than 30 inches in height.ORGuardrail is not securely attached and cannot reasonably protect from fall hazards.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all guardrails.- Visually inspect to identify any missing functional component(s) or damage. - Visually inspect to determine if the guardrail is securely attached at connection and anchor points. - Determine if the guardrail can reasonably protect from fall hazards.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the height of the guardrail.- Grab the guardrail and apply force to each section, pushing and pulling rapidly to determine if the guardrail is securely attached.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A functional component (e.g., top rail, base rail, anchor, fastener, post, baluster, or picket) is one that is critical to the guardrail protecting from fall hazards. - A decorative or ornamental component (e.g., post cap) should not be evaluated under this defect.

deficiency_areas.name: Handrail
deficiency_areas.definition: A rail fixed to posts or a wall for people to hold on to for support.
deficiency_areas.purpose: A rail designed to be grasped by the hand to provide stability or support. Handrails are commonly used while ascending or descending stairways and escalators in order to prevent injurious falls.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Rail; Baluster; Brackets; Anchor
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Handrail is missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Handrail is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for all areas with stairs or ramps, or along the walls in hallways where handrails may be present. - Verify a handrail is present on at least one side of each continuous run of treads.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Stairs: Count the number of steps.- Ramp: Measure the length and rise of the ramp.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Stairs: A handrail is required if 4 or more risers are present. - Ramp: When a ramp has a rise greater than 6 inches or a horizontal projection greater than 72 inches, then handrails must be present on both sides.

deficiency_area_items.description: Handrail is not secure.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: There is movement in the anchors of the handrail.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for movement of the handrail when tested.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Grab the handrail and rapidly push and pull the with moderate force. - Perform this action at both ends and the middle of the handrail. - If there is no movement, disregard this deficiency. - If there is movement, continue. - Ensure handrails are firmly attached with no movement at anchor points.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - The handrail and top rail of the stair rail system must be able to withstand, without failure, at least 200 pounds of weight applied within 2 inches of the top edge in any downward or outward direction, at any point along the top edge.

deficiency_area_items.description: Handrail is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Handrail is not functionally adequate (i.e., it cannot reasonably be grasped by hand to provide stability or support when ascending or descending stairways). ORHandrail is not continuous for the full length of each stair flight. ORHandrail is not between 28 inches and 42 inches in height.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to ensure that the handrail is continuous for the full length of each stair flight.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the height of the handrail.- Determine if the handrail is functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Handrail is not installed where required.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: 4 or more stair risers are present and a handrail is not installed. ORA ramp has a rise greater than 6 inches or a horizontal projection greater than 72 inches and a handrail is not installed on both sides.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for all areas with stairs or ramps, or along the walls in hallways where handrails may be present.- Verify handrail present on at least one side of each continuous run of treads.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Stairs: Count the number of steps.- Ramp: Measure the length and rise of the ramp.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: HVAC
deficiency_areas.definition: Heating: A system consisting of a heat source and method of distribution designed to heat the surrounding air and area. Ventilation: A method of air distribution by air ducts to transfer air from one location to another. Air can be distributed passively or forced. Air Conditioning: A system consisting of a cooling source and method of distribution designed to cool the surrounding air and area.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provide thermal comfort and acceptable indoor air quality.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Thermostat; Condenser; Furnace; Supply registers or vents; Ducts; Air handler; Radiant or convection heating covers; Boiler; Evaporative cooler; Thermocouple; Gas shutoff valve
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: The inspection date is on or between October 1 and March 31 and the permanently installed heating source is inoperable.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The inspection date is on or between October 1 and March 31 and the permanently installed heating source is inoperable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Determine if a permanently installed heating source is present. - If present, determine if the permanently installed heating is working.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A permanently installed heating source is: - one that is installed and self-fueled.  - permanently affixed within the unit or building. - safely connected to the unit or building electrical system. - thermostatically controlled by the unit or building.  - A permanently installed heating source may: - include forced air heating, radiant heat, baseboard units heated by electric, or installed wall units.  - have an electric, gas, or oil energy source. - A permanently installed heating source may not be:  - cooking appliances.  - portable space heaters.  - fireplaces or wood stoves. - This deficiency does not apply to:  - mechanical rooms or closets.  - Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, US Virgin Islands, Commonwealth of Northern Mariana Islands. - If a heat pump system is operating in the air conditioning mode, then do not test the heat mode
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - Ask the POA to engage the permanently installed heating source.

deficiency_area_items.description: Air conditioning system or device is not operational.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: System or device does not turn on.  OR System or device only produces hot or room temperature air.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for the cooling system or device (e.g., a window unit or access panel to a central air system) and determine if  it is on. - Listen to hear if the system or device powers on following a request to the POA.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Place your hand near the system or device to feel for cooled air.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If present and not on, ask the POA to turn the system or device on.

deficiency_area_items.description: Unvented space heater that burns gas, oil, or kerosene is present.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Unvented space heater that burns gas, oil, or kerosene is present.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the space heater to verify if vent is present.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - Ask the POA if the Inside is heated by a fuel burning device.

deficiency_area_items.description: Fuel burning heating system or device exhaust vent is misaligned, blocked, disconnected, improperly connected, damaged, or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Fuel burning heating system or device is present. ANDExhaust vent is misaligned, blocked, disconnected, or improperly connected through to the ceiling or wall. ORExhaust vent is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). ORExhaust vent is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at fuel burning heating system or device to confirm exhaust vent is:- Properly connected through to the ceiling or wall; and- Free of any holes or blockage due to bending, warping, collapse, or foreign material.- Check for exhaust vent cap.- Verify exhaust vent has no downward slope.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Metal tape is not a substitute for improperly connected flue vents.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - Ask the POA if the Inside is heated by a fuel burning device.

deficiency_area_items.description: Heating system or device safety shield is damaged or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Heating system or device safety shield is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) or missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect for any damage to the safety shield.  - Visually inspect for evidence that a safety shield was previously installed and is now not present or is incomplete.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: The inspection date is on or between April 1 and September 30 and a permanently installed heating source is damaged, inoperable, missing, or not installed.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The inspection date is on or between April 1 and September 30.  AND A permanently installed heating source is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). OR A permanently installed heating source is inoperable (i.e., not meeting function or purpose, with or without visible  damage). OR A permanently installed heating source is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is  incomplete).  OR A permanently installed heating source is not installed.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Determine if a permanently installed heating source is present.  - If present, visually inspect to identify any damage. - Determine if the permanently installed heating is working.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A permanently installed heating source is: - one that is installed and self-fueled.  - permanently affixed within the unit or building. - safely connected to the unit or building electrical system. - thermostatically controlled by the unit or building.  - A permanently installed heating source may: - include forced air heating, radiant heat, baseboard units heated by electric, or installed wall units.  - have an electric, gas, or oil energy source. - A permanently installed heating source may not be:  - cooking appliances.  - portable space heaters.  - fireplaces or wood stoves. - This deficiency does not apply to:  - mechanical rooms or closets.  - Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Guam, American Samoa, US Virgin Islands, Commonwealth of Northern Mariana Islands. - If a heat pump system is operating in the air conditioning mode, then do not test the heat mode.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - Ask the POA to engage the permanently installed heating source.

deficiency_area_items.description: Combustion chamber cover or gas shutoff valve is missing from a fuel burning heating appliance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Combustion chamber cover or gas shutoff valve is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete) from a fuel burning heating appliance.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the fuel burning heating appliance for evidence that a combustion chamber cover or gas shutoff valve was previously installed and is now not present or is incomplete.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If unable to locate, ask the POA to identify the location of the fuel burning heating appliance.

deficiency_areas.name: Infestation
deficiency_areas.definition: The presence of animals with potential impacts on resident health and safety.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: None
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Evidence of cockroaches.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence of cockroaches is found. Presence of dead or live cockroaches, shed skins, droppings (small black specks or smears), and egg cases (brown oblong cases: 5-9mm long). Three or fewer live cockroaches observed simultaneously in one location during the day are evidence of cockroaches.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for a dead or live cockroach, shed skins, droppings (small black specks or smears), and egg cases (brown oblong cases: 5-9mm long).
deficiency_area_items.action: - Using an inspection mirror and flashlight, carefully examine each of the following:  - Kitchen sink,  - Kitchen cabinets,  - Voids between and under appliances and cabinets,  - Ceiling-wall junction, - Bathroom,  - Tops of doors,  - Circuit breaker panel,  - Around outlets,  - Switches,  - Mechanical rooms, and - Water heaters. - Note that this is not an exhaustive list.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Extensive cockroach infestation.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sighting of at least one live cockroach in two or more separate locations in the building is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for any live cockroach. - At least one live cockroach in two or more separate locations in the building during a daytime surface visual  assessment is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Using an inspection mirror and flashlight, carefully examine each of the following:  - Kitchen sink,  - Kitchen cabinets,  - Voids between and under appliances and cabinets,  - Ceiling-wall junction, - Bathroom,  - Tops of doors,  - Circuit breaker panel,  - Around outlets,  - Switches,  - Mechanical rooms, and  - Water heaters. - Note that this is not an exhaustive list.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Evidence of bedbugs.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence of bedbugs is found (i.e., live or dead bedbugs, feces, eggs, or blood trails).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look near drapes, couches, corners of walls, upholstered furniture, and near outlets for evidence of bedbugs (i.e., live  or dead bedbugs, feces, eggs, or blood trails).  - (Note that this is not an exhaustive list of locations to inspect.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Enter the common areas and use a flashlight to search upholstered furniture, baseboards, walls, the corners of the  wall, and ceiling.  - Note that this is not an exhaustive list of locations where bedbug evidence can be cited.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Evidence of mice.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence of mice is found (i.e., a live or dead mouse or mice, droppings, chewed holes, or urine trails).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look in the kitchen, trash area, behind and under refrigerators and stoves, and under the sink and baseboard heater (Note that this is not an exhaustive list) for evidence of mice, such as droppings (size of grain of rice—small and smooth with pointed ends), chewed holes, urine trails, and odor.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If there is a sticky pad or trap with a mouse on it, record a deficiency. - If there is a sticky pad or trap without a mouse on it, do not record a deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Extensive mouse infestation.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sighting of at least one live mouse in two or more separate locations in the building during a daytime surface visual assessment.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look in the kitchen, trash area, behind and under refrigerators and stoves, and under the sink and baseboard heater  (Note that this is not an exhaustive list) for evidence of mice, such as droppings (size of grain of rice—small and smooth with pointed ends), chewed holes, urine trails, and odor. - At least one live mouse in two or more separate locations in the building during a daytime surface visual assessment is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Evidence of rats.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence of rats is found (i.e., dead rat or rats, droppings, or chewed holes).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look in all areas where trash and food are prevalent for: - Rat burrows, - Rat droppings (shiny, black and ½ to ¾ of an inch long)- Chewed holes in door sweeps or at the edges of outer doors (rat teeth are typically 1/8 inch long)- Rats (alive or dead).- Note that evidence of rats may be cited at any location Outside, not just in areas where trash and food are prevalent
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If there is a sticky pad or trap with a rat on it, record a deficiency.- If there is a sticky pad or trap without a rat on it, do not record a deficiency.- If a live rat is seen in the Outside, evaluate under this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Extensive rat infestation.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Live rat is seen in the Inside.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look in all areas where trash and food are prevalent for:  - Rat burrows,  - Rat droppings (shiny, black and ½ to ¾ of an inch long) - Chewed holes in door sweeps or at the edges of outer doors (rat teeth are typically 1/8 inch long) - Rats (alive). - Note that evidence of rats may be cited at any location Inside, not just in areas where trash and food are prevalent. - A live rat in the Inside is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Evidence of other pests.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Evidence is present of pest infestation other than cockroaches, bed bugs, mice, or rats. This may include, but is not limited to, wasps/wasp nests or bees/beehives, squirrels or squirrel nests, birds, or bats. Pests are animals with potential impacts on resident health and safety.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for evidence of 'other pests' Inside.  - Look for wasp nests and beehives present Inside.  - Look for evidence that 'other pests' have penetrated the building envelope and are present and/or nesting Inside.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Extensive bedbug infestation.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sighting of at least one live bedbug in two or more separate locations in the building is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look near drapes, couches, corners of walls, upholstered furniture, and near outlets for evidence of bedbugs (i.e., live  or dead bedbugs, feces, eggs, or blood trails).  - Note that this is not an exhaustive list of locations to inspect. - At least one live bedbug in two or more separate locations in the building during a daytime surface visual assessment  is a sign of extensive infestation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Enter the common areas and use a flashlight to search upholstered furniture, baseboards, walls, the corners of the  wall, and ceiling.  - Note that this is not an exhaustive list of locations where bedbug evidence can be cited.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Leak - Gas/Oil
deficiency_areas.definition: A fuel or gas leak refers to an unintended leak of natural gas or another gaseous product from a pipeline or other containment into any area where the gas or fuel should not be present. Gas leaks can be hazardous to health and the environment.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: Gas; Liquid; Pipe; Cap; Valve
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Natural gas, propane, or oil leak.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: There is evidence of a gas, propane, or oil leak.  OR There is an uncapped gas or fuel supply line.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look around the furnace, heating oil storage tanks, water heater, boiler, and other fuel-burning mechanical equipment and appliances for drips, puddles, or any visual signs of a leak.- Listen for any audible signs of a leak, such as hissing or whistling sounds. - Smell for any odors that may indicate a leak, such as the smell of sulfur (due to additives such as Mercaptan). - Visually inspect for an uncapped gas or fuel supply line.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If evidence is found, immediately notify the POA or property inspection escort.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Leak - Sewage
deficiency_areas.definition: A sewage system leak refers to the leakage of wastewater out of a sanitary sewer system.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: Liquid; Leach field; Gas trap; Sewer backup valve; Sewer line; Pipe; Drain; Sewer cleanout; Cap; Riser
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Blocked sewage system.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Wastewater is unable to drain resulting in sewer backup.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Observe a foul stench coming from drains. - Look for any slow-draining bathtubs or laundry lines.- Look to see if the use of other fixtures associated with main line lead to water backup in places such as toilets or showers.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Leak in sewage system.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: There is evidence of a sewer line or fitting leaking.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for evidence of a leaking sewer line or fitting to include stains, puddles, visible effluent, a strong odor, and infestation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Ask the POA for a copy of an approved sanitary system certificate.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Private sanitary systems are typically certified or approved by a local authority such as a building or health department.- Visible waste in a septic system leach field should be evaluated under this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Cap to the cleanout or pump cover is detached or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cap to the cleanout or pump cover is detached or missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at each cleanout and identify where the cleanout cap should be located. - Look at each pump and identify where the cover should be located.- As applicable, look to ensure that the cap or pump cover are present and securely attached. - Look on the ground along the outside of the building for PVC or metal piping that has a cleanout cap. - Locate the cleanout and caps by observing the vertical piping (stack) at the lowest level of the building. - Look between the main drain and the building’s sewer or septic system.
deficiency_area_items.action: - As applicable, gently touch or tap the cap or pump cover to verify if it is securely attached.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Cleanout cap or riser is damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cleanout cap or riser is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at each cleanout and thoroughly examine the riser and the cap. - Look for any holes or cracks in the riser or cap that would allow for contaminated air or sewage to seep out.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - This item is located on the ground and is often hit and cracked by lawnmowers. - Examples of damage that may impact functionality of the cleanout cap or riser may include, but are not limited to: - Unintentional hole- Intentionally drilled hole into the cap for easier access to the cleanout- Crack

deficiency_areas.name: Leak - Water
deficiency_areas.definition: A water leak can be caused by damage; including a puncture, gash, rust or other corrosion hole, very tiny pinhole leak (possibly in imperfect welds), crack or microcrack, or inadequate sealing between components or parts joined together.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: Gas trap; Piping, Drain, Cap, Riser, Plumbing pump, Pump system; Fire suppression sprinkler assembly, including connected pipes and fittings; Water heater; Boiler; Dishwasher; Garbage disposal; Sink; Valves
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Plumbing leak.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Failure of a plumbing system that allows for water intrusion in unintended areas.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Evaluate exterior plumbing systems for any leaks.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Examples of exterior plumbing components to evaluate under this deficiency may include, but are not limited to:- Exterior hose faucet- Landscaping sprinkler / irrigation system

deficiency_area_items.description: Fluid is leaking from the sprinkler assembly.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Fluid is leaking from the sprinkler assembly.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the fire suppression sprinkler assembly and its components to determine if any fluid is leaking from the sprinkler assembly.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A fire suppression sprinkler assembly is part of the fire protection (sprinkler) system that discharges water or another material when activated once reaching a certain (pre-determined) temperature.- Components of a sprinkler assembly may include, but are not limited to:- Head- Valve- Deflector- Escutcheon- Sprinkler head cover- Piping

deficiency_area_items.description: Environmental water intrusion.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Water from the exterior environment is leaking into the interior.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for any leaking or discoloration.  - Look for swelling windowsills or moisture around the interior of windows or doors.  - Look for deteriorating components on the ceiling or walls.  - Examine the interior for cracks, failing window glazing, and anywhere else that water could access the interior space.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If evidence of a leak is present and the leak is not active at the time of the inspection, determine if a repair was performed.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Water intrusion is the unwelcome presence of water leaking into the interior. - Water intrusion may be the result of structural damage, poor installation of building materials, degrading materials, or defective building materials.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If evidence of a leak is present and the leak is not active at the time of the inspection, ask the POA if leaking has occurred.

deficiency_areas.name: Lighting - Auxiliary
deficiency_areas.definition: Lighting that is essential to safety in the event of primary power supply failure.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Assist people egress a building in the event of an emergency.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Rechargeable battery backup; Light bulb; Circuits; Lamps; Test button; Housing assembly
deficiency_areas.more_information: Exit signs, exposed wiring, and cut hazards are related standards

deficiency_area_items.description: Auxiliary lighting is damaged, missing, or fails to illuminate when tested.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Auxiliary lighting is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality), missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete), or fails to illuminate when tested.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify any damage that impacts functionality. - Identify any evidence that auxiliary lighting was previously installed but is now not present or is incomplete. - Verify that the device responds to the test and illuminates.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Engage the test button.- Verify the emergency light illuminates for the entire time the test button is engaged.- Verify all light sources illuminate during the test.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A combination auxiliary light and exit sign device should be evaluated under both the Lighting – Auxiliary and Exit Sign standards

deficiency_areas.name: Lighting - Exterior
deficiency_areas.definition: Fixed artificial lighting (e.g., walkway lighting, pole lighting, wall packs, and canopy lights) that is used to illuminate exterior areas (e.g., entryways, parking lots, and exterior stairwells).
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provide illumination of the building exterior and surrounding grounds in order to provide safe travel and enhanced security.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Fixture casing; Ballast; Wires; Starter socket; Tube socket; Tube receptacle; Ballast attachment screw; Light posts; Globes
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: A permanently installed light fixture is damaged, inoperable, missing, or not secure.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A permanently installed light fixture is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).  OR A permanently installed light fixture is inoperable (i.e., overall system or component thereof is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage).  OR A permanently installed light fixture is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).  OR A permanently installed light fixture is not secure to the designed attachment point or the attachment point is not stable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all permanently installed light fixtures.- After activating, verify if each light fixture is fully illuminated (i.e., each lightbulb illuminates).- Visually inspect for any signs of a missing or damaged light fixtures. - Determine if each light fixture is secure.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Attempt to activate each light fixture. - After evaluating, turn off each light fixture.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If permanently installed light fixture is controlled by a photoelectric sensor or timer that does not permit testing when daylight, then only evaluate this item to determine if it is damaged, missing, or not secure.  - If a lightbulb does not illumate, then the POA may attempt to change the lightbulb.  - If an electrical conductor is not enclosed or properly insulated, then it should be evaluated under the Electrical – Conductor, Outlet, and Switch standard

deficiency_areas.name: Lighting - Interior
deficiency_areas.definition: Permanently installed light fixture.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Provide illumination for interior spaces.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Fixture casing; Ballast; Wires; Starter socket; Tube socket, Tube receptacle; Ballast attachment screw; Light posts; Control switch
deficiency_areas.more_information: A switch that is inoperable but does not have visible damage and corresponds to a permanently installed lighting fixture should be evaluated under this standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: A permanently installed light fixture is inoperable.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A permanently installed light fixture is inoperable (i.e., the overall system or component thereof is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all permanently installed light fixtures. - After activating, verify if each light fixture is fully illuminated (i.e., each lightbulb illuminates)
deficiency_area_items.action: - Attempt to activate each light fixture.  - After evaluating, turn off each light fixture.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If a lightbulb does not illumate, then the POA may attempt to change the lightbulb.

deficiency_area_items.description: A permanently installed light fixture is not secure.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A permanently installed light fixture is not secure to the designed attachment point or the attachment point is not stable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all permanently installed light fixtures. - Visually determine if each light fixture is secure.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If an electrical conductor is not enclosed or properly insulated, then it should be evaluated under the Electrical – Conductor, Outlet, and Switch standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: At least one (1) permanently installed light fixture is not present in the kitchen and bathroom.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: At least one (1) permanently installed light fixture is not present in the kitchen and bathroom.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually determine if both the kitchen and bathroom have at least one (1) permanently installed light fixture.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Litter
deficiency_areas.definition: Waste discarded or disposed of in a location that is not designated for waste.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: Paper; Metal; Plastics; Organic; Wood; Foam; Cardboard; Rubber; Large furniture; Appliances
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Litter is accumulated in an undesignated area.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: 10 or more small items of litter (e.g., food wrappers, pieces of food, newspapers) are present within a 10-foot by 10-foot area not designated for garbage.  OR Any number of large items (e.g., furniture or appliances) have been clearly discarded in an area not designated for garbage.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for garbage or litter in undesignated areas. - Identify small items of litter in undesignated areas. - Identify any number of large items clearly discarded in undesignated areas.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure a 10-foot x 10-foot area around the densest accumulation of litter.  - Count the number of items of litter within the measured area.  - Do not count beyond 10 items of litter.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Mold-Like Substance
deficiency_areas.definition: A "Mold-like substance" can include regular or irregular patches or spots on surfaces that may be colored differently than the surface (coloration may be white, green, yellow, gray, brown, or black), and can be raised from the surface, and are generally composed of minute filaments. A "Mold-like substance" can appear "fuzzy" or "cottony" and a musty or earthy odor can be associated with it.  "Mold-like substance" would also include what is often identified as "mildew," i.e., small patches, generally on non-porous surfaces, and dusty (friable) when dry; mildew is generally a thin surface growth that can be wiped off easily. Note that algae are not mold-like substances (algae are grass-green).
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: None
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Presence of mold-like substance at moderate levels is observed visually.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cumulative area of patches is more than 4 square inches and less than 1 square foot in a room.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Estimate area(s) of all patch(s) and spot(s).  - If the total cumulative area of all patches and spots in a room is more than 4 square inches and less than 1 square foot, record this deficiency.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Presence of mold-like substance at high levels is observed visually.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cumulative area of patches is more than 1 square foot and less than 9 square feet in a room.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Estimate area(s) of all patch(es) and spot(s). - If the total cumulative area of all patches and spots in a room is more than 1 square foot and less than nine square feet, record this deficiency.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Presence of mold-like substance at extremely high levels is observed visually.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cumulative area of patches is more than 9 square foot in a room.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Estimate area(s) of all patch(s) and spot(s). - If the total cumulative area of all patches and spots in a room is more than nine square feet, record this deficiency.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Elevated moisture level.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Elevated moisture level.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect for evidence of elevated moisture level (e.g., peeling paint or wallpaper, a wall that is warped or stained, or a buckled, cracked, or water-stained ceiling, carpet, or wooden floor).
deficiency_area_items.action: - If evidence of elevated moisture level is present, then test for the condition using a pinless moisture meter.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Infrared cameras are optional and will not be used on their own to evaluate this a deficiency. If a thermal anomaly is observed using an infrared camera, the moisture meter must be used to confirm whether there is elevated moisture present. - If evidence of an active leak is present, evaluate the condition under the Leak – Water standard or the Leak – Sewage System standard, respectively.  - If mold-like substance is present, then evaluate the condition under Deficiency 1, Deficiency 2, Deficiency 3, or Deficiency 4 of this standard

deficiency_areas.name: Parking Lot
deficiency_areas.definition: A designated outdoor area for parking motorized vehicles.
deficiency_areas.purpose: An area to park motorized vehicles.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Pavement; Pavers; Wheel stops; Striping; Gravel
deficiency_areas.more_information: For the purpose of this inspection, this item does not include parking garages.

deficiency_area_items.description: Parking lot has any one pothole that is 4 inches deep and 1 square foot or greater.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Parking lot has any one pothole that is 4 inches deep and 1 square foot or greater.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify each pothole in the parking lot.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the depth and area of each pothole.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Parking lot has ponding.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: More than 3 inches of water has accumulated in a parking lot and 5%% or more of the parking lot is unusable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for ponding in a parking lot.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the depth of the ponding water.  - If it is 3 inches or greater in depth, measure the square footage of ponding area.  - Calculate the percentage of unusable space using the following formula:  - (Overall square footage of the parking lot - effected area) / remaining total area of the parking lot
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Potential Lead-Based Paint Hazards - Visual Assessment
deficiency_areas.definition: Lead-based paint (LBP) is paint or other surface coatings that contain lead equal to or exceeding federal regulatory levels, currently 1.0 milligram per square centimeter or 0.5 percent by weight. Deteriorated paint or surface coatings found in homes built before 1978 are LBP hazards if the paint is LBP. Visual Assessment is surface by surface determination of paint condition.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Lead was added to paint to accelerate drying, increase durability, maintain a fresh appearance, and resist moisture that causes corrosion.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Surfaces include Walls, Ceilings, Trim, Doors, Windows, Floors
deficiency_areas.more_information: - Unit corresponds to “Interior,” Inside corresponds to “Common Areas,” and Outside corresponds to “Exterior” in the Lead Safe Housing Rule (24 CFR Part 35, Subparts B–R). - Target properties are determined based on the property profile. - Property Profile: Housing constructed prior to 1978.

deficiency_area_items.description: Paint Outside on a target property is deteriorated – above the level required for lead-safe work practices by a lead-certified firm and passing clearance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Paint is deteriorated (e.g., peeling, chipping, chalking, cracking, or detached from the substrate). Deteriorated paint is more than 20 square feet (“significant”).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Property Profile: Examine the property profile to determine if the property was built pre-1978. If it was built in 1978 or afterwards, peeling paint is not a deficiency. If the building was built pre-1978, continue with these steps. - Please note: For the purposes of this inspection, if the property profile states that the property was constructed pre-1978, you must assume that all painted structures on the property were built pre-1978. - For large Outside surfaces: - Look at large Outside surface areas that are painted, including siding, fascia, soffit, trim, patios or decks, fencing, and any other large painted surfaces on the Outside of the building. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, damage to the surface such as holes that expose paint layers, and friction on painted surfaces. - Check painted surfaces that are subject to friction (e.g., painted steps, doors that rub on the jamb, wood window sashes) or impact (e.g., doorknobs that bang on walls) for wear; if wear is visible, include the worn area in the total Outside deteriorated area.
deficiency_area_items.action: - For large Outside surfaces: - Evaluate the square footage of the damage or deterioration across all Outside large surfaces throughout the  whole of the Outside of the entire building cumulatively.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - This deficiency is a Severe Health and Safety Determination; paint stabilization within 30 days will follow the Lead Safe Housing Rule (LSHR)

deficiency_area_items.description: Paint in a Unit or Inside the target property is deteriorated – above the level required for lead-safe work practices by a lead-certified firm and passing clearance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Paint is deteriorated (e.g., peeling, chipping, chalking, cracking, or detached from the substrate). For large surface areas Inside the target property, deteriorated paint is more than 2 square feet, per room; for small surface areas, greater than 10% per component (“significant”).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Property Profile: Examine the property profile to determine if the property was built pre-1978. If it was built in 1978 or afterwards, peeling paint is not a deficiency. If the building was built pre-1978, continue these steps. - Please note: For the purposes of this inspection, if the property profile states that the property was constructed pre-1978, you must assume that all painted structures on the property were built pre-1978. - For large surfaces in the Unit or Inside (e.g., walls, ceilings, and floors): - Look at large painted surface areas in the Unit, including walls, ceilings, doors, and floors. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, damage to the surface such as holes that expose paint layers, and friction on painted surfaces. - For small components in the Unit or Inside (e.g., windowsills, window trough, trim): - Look at small painted surface areas, including trim, doors, windows, windowsills, baseboards, and built-ins. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, damage to the surface such as holes that xpose paint layers, and friction on painted surfaces.
deficiency_area_items.action: - For large surfaces in the Unit or Inside (e.g., walls, ceilings, and floors): - Evaluate the approximate length and width of the damage or deterioration. Determine the total area, per room, of the peeling or deteriorated paint. - For small components in the Unit or Inside (e.g., windowsills, window trough, trim): - Check painted surfaces that are subject to friction (e.g., painted steps, doors that rub on the jamb, wood window sashes) or impact (e.g., doorknobs that bang on walls) for wear; if wear is visible, include the worn area in the total Unit or Inside deteriorated area.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - This deficiency is a Severe Health and Safety Determination; paint stabilization within 30 days will follow the Lead Safe Housing Rule (LSHR).

deficiency_area_items.description: Paint in a Unit or Inside the target property is deteriorated – below the level required for lead-safe work practices by a lead-certified firm or for passing clearance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Paint is deteriorated (e.g., peeling, chipping, chalking, cracking, or detached from the substrate). For large surface areas inside the target property, deteriorated paint is less than or equal to 2 square feet, per room; for small surface areas, less than or equal to 10% per component (“de minimis ”).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Property Profile: Examine the property profile to determine if the property was built pre-1978. If it was built in 1978 or afterwards, peeling paint is not a deficiency. If the building was built pre-1978, continue these steps. - Please note: For the purposes of this inspection, if the property profile states that the property was constructed pre-1978, you must assume that all painted structures on the property were built pre-1978. - For large surfaces in the Unit or Inside (e.g., walls, ceilings, and floors): - Look at large painted surface areas in the Unit, including walls, ceilings, doors, and floors. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, damage to the surface such as holes that expose paint layers, and friction on painted surfaces. - For small components in the Unit or Inside (e.g., windowsills, window trough, trim): - Look at small painted surface areas, including trim, doors, windows, windowsills, baseboards, and built-ins. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, damage to the surface such as holes that expose paint layers, and friction on painted surfaces.
deficiency_area_items.action: - For large surfaces in the Unit or Inside (e.g., walls, ceilings, and floors): - Evaluate the approximate length and width of the damage or deterioration. Determine the total area, per room, of the peeling or deteriorated paint. - For small components in the Unit or Inside (e.g., windowsills, window trough, trim): - Check painted surfaces that are subject to friction (e.g., painted steps, doors that rub on the jamb, wood window sashes) or impact (e.g., doorknobs that bang on walls) for wear; if wear is visible, include the worn area in the total Unit or Inside deteriorated area.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Paint Outside on a target property is deteriorated – below the level required for lead-safe work practices by a lead-certified firm or for passing clearance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Paint is deteriorated (e.g., peeling, chipping, chalking, cracking, or detached from the substrate). Deteriorated paint is less than or equal to 20 square feet (“de minimis”).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Property Profile: Examine the property profile to determine if the property was built pre-1978. If it was built in 1978 or afterwards, peeling paint is not a deficiency. If the building was built pre-1978, continue with these steps. - Please note: For the purposes of this inspection, if the property profile states that the property was constructed pre-1978, you must assume that all painted structures on the property were built pre-1978. - For large Outside surfaces: - Look at large Outside surface areas that are painted, including siding, fascia, soffit, trim, patios or decks, fencing, and any other large painted surfaces on the Outside of the building. Examine these areas for peeling or deteriorated paint, and for holes. - Check painted surfaces that are subject to friction (e.g., painted steps, doors that rub on the jamb, wood window sashes) or impact (e.g., doorknobs that bang on walls), for wear; if wear is visible, include the worn area in the total Outside deteriorated area.
deficiency_area_items.action: - For large Outside surfaces: - Evaluate the square footage of the damage or deterioration across all Outside large surfaces throughout the  whole of the Outside of the entire building cumulatively.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Private Roads and Driveways
deficiency_areas.definition: Road leading from a public road to a dwelling or garage.
deficiency_areas.purpose: An area on private property where automobiles and other vehicles are operated or allowed to stand.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Asphalt; Concrete; Dirt; Gravel; Paving stones; Expansion joints; Curbs; Gutters; Utility access covers; Rebar
deficiency_areas.more_information: For the purpose of this inspection, only inspect private roads owned and maintained by the property. If you have any doubt about ownership of the road, ask the POA to provide documentation clarifying the ownership of the road.

deficiency_area_items.description: Road or driveway has any one pothole that is 4 inches deep and 1 square foot or greater.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any one pothole is 4 inches deep and 1 square foot or greater.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify each pothole throughout the road or driveway.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the depth and area of each pothole.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Road or driveway access to the property is blocked or impassable for vehicles.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Road or driveway access to the property is blocked or impassable for vehicles.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at each road that provides access to the property. - Look to ensure that each road providing access to the property is free from any obstruction that would render the road blocked or impassable (e.g., downed trees, debris, impassable holes, snowbanks, parked cars, or flooding that would prevent a vehicle from gaining access to the property).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - For the purpose of this inspection, do not record this deficiency for designed permanent fixtures installed to control access (e.g., electronic gates or locked fences). If the property has these, the POA must show that they function and allow access to the road or driveway.  - Temporary obstructions for a specific function (e.g., road maintenance) should not be recorded as a deficiency.

deficiency_areas.name: Refrigerator
deficiency_areas.definition: A device designed to keep food from spoiling by cooling and freezing.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To keep food cold in order to help extend freshness by slowing down the activity of bacteria.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Compressor; Condenser coils; Evaporator coils; Handle; Shelves; Lightbulb; Drawer; Expansion valve; Seals; Door
deficiency_areas.more_information: For the purpose of this inspection, a built-in freezer is considered a component part of the refrigerator.  - Resident-owned, standalone freezers should not be evaluated under this standard.  - Any stored appliance not in use or a medical use refrigerator should not be evaluated under this standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Refrigerator is inoperable such that it may be unable to safely and adequately store food.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Refrigerator is inoperable (i.e., overall system is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage) such that it may be unable to safely and adequately store food.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Open the refrigerator door to feel for a cold temperature. - Open the freezer door to verify if food is frozen.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Refrigerator component is damaged such that it impacts functionality.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Refrigerator component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective) such that it impacts functionality.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the accessible portions of the refrigerator for any component that is damaged such that it impacts functionality.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: Examples of damaged components that may impact functionality include, but are not limited to:  - Seal that is hanging, sagging, separating, torn with exposed magnet, or detached from the door - Handle - Interior lining

deficiency_areas.name: Retaining Wall
deficiency_areas.definition: A vertical structure that retains soil or rock at various grades.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To prevent erosion on sloped land or to add usable space.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Post; Railing; Block
deficiency_areas.more_information: For the purpose of this inspection, a “retaining wall” is only classified as such if it is at least 24 inches tall and does not include decorative planters or foundation wall.

deficiency_area_items.description: Retaining wall is leaning away from the fill side.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Retaining wall is leaning away from the fill side.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the retaining wall while standing parallel to determine if the wall is standing upright.  - Verify the wall is not more than 90 degrees from the base of the slope.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the retaining wall to verify the height is 24 inches or greater.  - If it is not at least 24 inches, then it is not subject to inspection.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Measure the retaining wall to verify the height is 24 inches or greater.  - If it is not at least 24 inches, then it is not subject to inspection.

deficiency_area_items.description: Retaining wall is partially or completely collapsed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Retaining wall is partially or completely collapsed.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the entire retaining wall for signs of collapse.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Roof Assembly
deficiency_areas.definition: The external upper covering of a house or other building.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Protect the interior from the exterior elements, as well as collect and redirect the accumulation of precipitation from the roof surface to the ground or drainage system.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Roof covering; Drain; Gutter; Downspout; Flashing; Roof exhaust system; Scupper; Eave; Soffit; Fascia
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Roof assembly is damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Roof assembly is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the roof’s perimeter soffits, eaves, fascia, and roof decking for damage.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If a roof assembly component is missing, then it should be evaluatd under this deficiency.  - All attic or roof ventilation components should be evaluated under this deficiency.  - If the overall roof assembly exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard

deficiency_area_items.description: Restricted flow of water from a roof drain, gutter, or downspout.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Debris is limiting the ability of water to drain; water may not be present.  OR  An area of approximately 25 square feet of ponding water is located above the drain.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the roof drain, gutter, or downspout for ponding water. - Look for evidence of clogging (e.g., debris, leaves, or soil).
deficiency_area_items.action: - If visually accessible, inspect the roof drain and gutters.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - It may not be possible to gain access to the roof in single family units.

deficiency_area_items.description: Gutter component is damaged, missing, or unfixed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Gutter component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).  OR Gutter component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).  OR Gutter component is unfixed.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the gutter system to detect any:  - Gutter components that are damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). - Gutter components that are missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).  - Gutter components that are unfixed (i.e., pulled away from the fascia or roofing structure).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Gutters may not be present on all properties.

deficiency_area_items.description: Roof surface has standing water.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Water ponding in an area approximately 25 square feet or greater on a flat roof surface not near a drain or scupper.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if the building has a flat roof; if not, disregard this deficiency.  - Look for ponding water on the roof that isn’t located above a drain or scupper.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the ponding.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Substrate is exposed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any amount of substrate is exposed.
