deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the roof surface for evidence of exposed substrate (e.g., missing or damaged shingles, tiles, or membrane).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - It may be difficult to determine if there is exposed substrate in single family homes

deficiency_area_items.description: Roof assembly has a hole.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Unintentional hole of any size is found.  OR Intentional hole of any size is found and is not covered by a vent or screen.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the roof’s soffits, eaves, fascia, and roof decking for holes.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Sharp Edges
deficiency_areas.definition: Physical hazards within the built environment (i.e., human-made structures, features, and facilities) that can lacerate or puncture skin.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: None
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: A sharp edge that can result in a cut or puncture hazard is present.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A sharp edge that can result in a cut or puncture hazard that is likely to require emergency care (e.g., stitches) is present on or adjacent to the built environment (i.e., human-made structures, features, and facilities).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look along the normal paths of travel throughout the built environment (e.g., sidewalks, walkways, playgrounds,  courtyards) to identify any sharp edge that can result in a cut or puncture hazard.  - If present, determine if the sharp edge is likely to require emergency care if the resident comes into contact with it.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Examples of sharp edges in the Outside area include, but are not limited to, broken glass or protruding rebar.

deficiency_areas.name: Sidewalk, Walkway, Ramp
deficiency_areas.definition: A pathway for pedestrian travel.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To provide a defined and safe path of exterior travel for pedestrians.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Approach; Landing; Flared sides
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sidewalk, walkway, or ramp is blocked or impassable.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sidewalk, walkway, or ramp is blocked or impassable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at all sidewalks, walkways, and ramps and identify if there is any obstruction or blockage.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Overgrown vegetation may result in the sidewalk, walkway, or ramp being blocked or impassable.

deficiency_area_items.description: Sidewalk, walkway, or ramp is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sidewalk, walkway, or ramp is not functionally adequate (i.e., does not provide a defined and safe path of exterior travel for pedestrians).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at all sidewalks, walkways, and ramps and determine if it provides a defined and safe path of travel.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: Conditions that may impact the functional adequacy of a sidewalk, walkway, or ramp may include, but are not limited  to:  - Damage or deterioration to the extent that it disrupts a person's ability to traverse the plane - Unintentional dimensional changes that may interrupt a person's walking pattern or movement - Unstable materia

deficiency_areas.name: Sink
deficiency_areas.definition: A basin with hardware designed to dispense and hold clean water (hot and cold) and discharge wastewater.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Typically used for cooking, cleaning, and drinking.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Basin; Faucet; Handle; Drain; Drain line; Supply valve; Supply line; Splash guard; Drain control; Sink overflow
deficiency_areas.more_information: If a sink does not hold water, then evaluate the condition under the Leak – Water standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Water is directed outside of the basin.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Water is directed outside of the basin.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Activate faucet. - Confirm that water is directed into basin and not outside of the basin. - Turn water control off.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sink is not draining.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Water is not draining from the basin of the sink.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if water is draining.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Pull the stopper handle, or if available, insert the stopper in order to seal the drain. - Activate the faucet to partially fill the sink with water. - Push the stopper handle or remove the stopper.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sink is improperly installed, pulling away from the wall, leaning, or there are gaps between the sink and wall.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sink is improperly installed, pulling away from the wall, leaning, or there are gaps between the sink and wall.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Inspect for the following:  - Signs of the sink pulling away from the wall. - Presence of a gap between the sink and the wall. - Movement of the sink when activating the faucet. - The front edge of the sink leaning downward. - If the sink is mounted on a vanity, signs of separation at the seams of a vanity. - If the sink is mounted on a vanity, signs the vanity is pulling away from the wall.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sink component is damaged or missing and the sink is functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sink component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) or missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) and the sink is functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect any present sink for damage.  - Visually inspect for any component that is damaged or missing.  - Determine if sink is functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A stopper that is missing or is not functionally adequate should be evaluated under this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Cannot activate or deactivate hot and cold water.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Control knobs do not activate or deactivate hot and cold water.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Activate control knobs to verify if both hot and cold water is dispensed and can be regulated. - Turn the water control off.  - Verify water does not dispense when turned to the off position.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sink or sink component is damaged or missing and the sink is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sink or sink component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) or missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) and the sink is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect for any evidence of a sink's prior installation where it is now not present or is incomplete.  - Visually inspect any present sink for damage.  - Visually inspect for any component that is damaged or missing.  - Determine if sink is functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If a sink is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) or not installed (i.e., never installed, but should have been) in the primary kitchen, then evaluate the condition under Deficiency 7 of this standard.  - A sink is not functionally adequate if it is unable to dispense and hold clean water and discharge wastewater. - A stopper that is missing or is not functionally adequate should be evaluated under Deficiency 5 of this standard.

deficiency_areas.name: Site Drainage
deficiency_areas.definition: An exterior system that directs the flow of surface water.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To direct surface water away from the built environment (i.e., human-made structures, features, and facilities) to a designated location.
deficiency_areas.common_components: surface water away from the built environment (i.e., human-made structures, features, and facilities) to a designated location. COMMON COMPONENTS: Culverts; Swales; Ditches; Retention and detention basins; Curb; Drainage features; Underground piping
deficiency_areas.more_information: Decorative items should not be evaluated under this standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Water runoff is unable to flow through the site drainage system.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Standing water is present above the outflow pipe entrance. OR Drainage is blocked such that the inspector believes water is unable to drain in the event of precipitation.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the site drainage system to determine the location of the site drain, which is typically at the lowest points on a property where water is likely to collect, or where the site drainage has diverted water.  - Once located, look to determine if water is present above the outflow drain or if debris has accumulated such that the inspector believes water is unable to drain in the event of precipitation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Shine light in the drainage system looking for obstruction.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Do not examine city or public works systems. - Standing water may be present in a canal system or swale system and should not be considered a deficiency under this standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Erosion is present.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Erosion is present and the footer is exposed.  OR Erosion is more than 2 feet away from the built environment and its depth is equal to or greater than its measured distance from the built environment, and the inspector believes it may undermine the supporting soil.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at all site drainage locations and identify signs of displaced soil or stone.  - If within 2 feet from the built environment, look to determine if the footer is exposed.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If identified, measure the distance between the built structure and the nearest point of erosion.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Damage to the built environment caused by erosion should be evaluated under the respective item’s standard, which may include but is not limited to: - Fence – Security - Foundation  - Parking Lot - Private Roads and Driveways - Retaining Wall - Sidewalk, Walkway, and Ramp - Trip Hazard

deficiency_area_items.description: Grate is not secure or does not cover the site drainage system’s collection point.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Grate is not secure or does not cover the site drainage system’s collection point.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the site drainage system to determine location of the site drain, which is typically at the lowest points on a property where water is likely to collect, or where the site drainage has diverted water.  - Once located, look to determine if the system was designed to have a protective grate (e.g., mounting hardware, supporting ledge, bracket, hinge, gates) that is now not secure or does not cover the drainage system’s collection  point.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - This deficiency only applies to a site drainage system that is designed to have a protective grate.

deficiency_areas.name: Smoke Alarm
deficiency_areas.definition: A self-contained device that detects the presence of smoke, typically as an indicator of fire, and provides a visual or audio signal as an alert.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To detect the presence of smoke and provide alert.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Plastic shell, Base, Battery, Light, Speaker, Test button, Electronic circuit; Battery backup
deficiency_areas.more_information: - Smoke alarm should be installed high on walls or ceilings.  - If mounted on the ceiling, then it must be greater than 4 inches from the wall.  - If mounted on the wall, then it cannot be closer than 4 inches or greater than 12 inches from the ceiling.  - Smoke alarm should be installed at least 10 feet from a cooking appliance.  - Smoke alarm should not:  - Be installed near windows, doors, or ducts where drafts might interfere with their operation.  - Be painted or have decorative stickers or other decorations present.

deficiency_area_items.description: Smoke alarm is not installed where required.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Smoke alarm is not installed inside each classroom. AND Smoke alarm is not installed outside the classroom(s). AND Smoke alarm is not installed on each level.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Observe each location where a smoke alarm is required.  - Verify a smoke alarm is present.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A smoke alarm installed within a hallway in the immediate vicinity of multiple classrooms meets the requirement of 'outside the classroom(s)' under this standard.  - A smoke alarm installed outside a classroom may meet the requirement of 'on each level' under this standard.  - If a smoke alarm is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete) from a non-required area, then it should not be evaluated under this standard.  - If another hazard is present, then it should be evaluated under the respective Standard (e.g., an exposed conductor should be evaluated under the Electrical – Conductor, Outlet, and Switch standard).

deficiency_area_items.description: Smoke alarm is obstructed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Smoke alarm is obstructed.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for presence of a smoke alarm.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Determine if the smoke alarm is covered by a foreign object (e.g., plastic bag, shower cap, zip tie, paint, tape).
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A combination smoke and CO alarm should be evaluated under both the Carbon Monoxide Alarm and Smoke Alarm standards.

deficiency_area_items.description: Smoke alarm does not produce an audio or visual alarm when tested.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Smoke alarm does not produce an audio or visual alarm when tested.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the smoke alarm to find a test button.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Press the test button and determine if the light on the smoke alarm flashes, strobes, or changes pattern in any way. - Listen to hear if an alarm is emitted from the smoke alarm at an audible level to alert the resident.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the alarm does not cease after testing, then evaluate the condition under this deficiency.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If no test button is present, then ask the POA for a smoke alarm maintenance certificate.

deficiency_areas.name: Sprinkler Assembly
deficiency_areas.definition: Part of the fire protection (sprinkler) system that discharges water when activated once reaching a certain (predetermined) temperature.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Help control the spread of fire.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Head; Valve; Deflector; Escutcheon; Sprinkler head cover
deficiency_areas.more_information: If a leak is present, evaluate the deficiency under the Leak – Water standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Sprinkler head assembly is encased or obstructed by an item or object that is within 18 inches of the sprinkler head.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sprinkler head assembly is encased or obstructed by an item or object that is within 18 inches of the sprinkler head.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the sprinkler assembly and the surrounding area for any obstruction or encasement. - Determine if items have been stored or stacked around the sprinkler head or if alterations have been made that impede the sprinkler head assembly.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If present, measure the distance from the obstruction or encasement to the sprinkler head.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Some sprinkler heads may not have 18' clearance due to features within the built environment (e.g., closet, permanently installed light fixture, exit sign) and should not be considered a deficiency under this Standard.  - A parked vehicle within 18' of the sprinkler assembly should not be considered a deficiency under this Standard.  - Examples of encasements may include, but are not limited to:  - Painter's tape - Plastic bag - Examples of obstructions may include, but are not limited to:  - Furniture - Shelves - Stacked materials

deficiency_area_items.description: Sprinkler assembly component is damaged, inoperable, or missing and it is detrimental to performance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sprinkler assembly component is damaged, inoperable, or missing and it is detrimental to performance.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the sprinkler assembly and its components to identify any damage or evidence of prior installation. - Determine if there are any conditions present that may be detrimental to the performance of the sprinkler assembly.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - For the purpose of this Standard, a condition is detrimental to performance if it impacts the sprinkler assembly's ability to properly or adequately discharge when activated.  - Examples of conditions that may be detrimental to performance may include, but are not limited to:  - Physical damage - Glass bulb has lost fluid - Concealed sprinkler cover plate is caulked or glued to ceiling - Missing sprinkler head escutcheon

deficiency_area_items.description: Sprinkler assembly has evidence of corrosion.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Sprinkler assembly has evidence of corrosion.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the sprinkler assembly and its components to identify any evidence of corrosion.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Sprinkler assembly has evidence of foreign material that is detrimental to performance.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Foreign material covers 75%% or more of the sprinkler assembly.  OR Foreign material covers 75%% or more of the glass bulb.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the sprinkler assembly to identify if any foreign material is present. - Look at the glass bulb to identify if any foreign material is present.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If foreign material is present, determine if it covers 75%% or more of the sprinkler assembly or 75%% or more of the glass bulb.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - For the purpose of this Standard, a condition is detrimental to performance if it impacts the sprinkler assembly's ability to properly or adequately discharge when activated.  - Examples of foreign material that may be detrimental to performance may include, but are not limited to:  - Loading / dust - Paint

deficiency_areas.name: Stairs
deficiency_areas.definition: A single step, series of steps, or flights of steps that connect two levels.
deficiency_areas.purpose: For (personal) traffic (i.e., egress or ingress) going from one level to the next.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Tread; Stringer; Riser; Railing; Nosing
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Tread is missing or damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Tread on a set of stairs is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete). OR  Tread on a set of stairs is loose or unlevel. OR  A portion of the tread nosing that is greater than 1 inch in depth or 4 inches wide is damaged or broken.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the entire set of stairs for the presence of treads.  - If present, examine each tread and nosing for damage. - Identify evidence of a previously installed tread that is now not present or is incomplete.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If tread nosing is damaged or broken, measure each occurrence.  - Walk up the entire set of stairs, ensuring that contact is made with the treads to detect each tread’s stability and  structural integrity.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If accessory treads are present, then verify if they are secure and level.

deficiency_area_items.description: Stringer is damaged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Stringer is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the entire set of stairs and, if visible, examine the stringers for signs of damage. - If instability is detected while walking on the stairs, look to determine if instability is likely caused by a damaged  stringer. - Look to ensure the stringer is attached to the structure.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Walk up the entire set of stairs to determine the stability of the stairs (i.e., feel for stability or bouncing).
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Generally, stringers may only be visible on exterior stairs.  - If not visible, then the inspector is unable to evaluate this deficiency.

deficiency_areas.name: Steps and Stairs
deficiency_areas.definition: A single step, series of steps, or flights of steps that connect two levels.
deficiency_areas.purpose: For (personal) traffic (i.e., egress or ingress) going from one level to the next.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Tread; Stringer; Riser; Railing; Nosing
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Step or stair is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Step or stair is not functionally adequate (i.e., may not allow for personal traffic from one level to the next).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at each step and stair and determine if it allows for personal traffic from one level to the next.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: Conditions that may impact the functional adequacy of a step or stairs may include, but are not limited to:  - Damage or deterioration to the extent that it disrupts a person's ability to move from one level to the next - Unintentional dimensional changes that may interrupt a person's walking pattern or movement - Unstable materia

deficiency_areas.name: Structure
deficiency_areas.definition: Load-bearing system within the built environment (i.e., structures, features, and facilities).
deficiency_areas.purpose: Safely support and transfer weight load.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Foundation; Beam; Floor; Wall; Roof; Slab; Plinth
deficiency_areas.more_information: If failure is present at a structural element, then it should be evaluated under the respective standard, which may include:  - Ceiling  - Chimney  - Floor  - Foundation  - Roof Assembly  - Wall – Exterior  - Wall – Interior

deficiency_area_items.description: Structural system exhibits signs of serious failure.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Structural system exhibits signs of serious failure and may threaten the resident’s safety.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the structural system for signs of failure.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If signs of failure are present and cannot be attributed to a specific structural element, then evaluate under this standard.  - If failure is present at a structural element, then it should be evaluated under the respective standard, which may include: - Ceiling - Chimney  - Floor - Foundation - Roof Assembly - Wall – Exterior  - Wall – Interior
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If an area within this inspection location is locked, request access from the POA.

deficiency_areas.name: Toilet
deficiency_areas.definition: A plumbing fixture used to receive human waste and to discharge it through a waste pipe, using water as a conveying method.
deficiency_areas.purpose: To discharge human waste.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Tank; Bowl; Lid; Seat; Flush handle; Drain; Drain lines; Supply valve; Supply line; Wax ring; Float ball; Float cup; Refill tube; Ballcock; Trip lever; Chain; Flapper; Overflow tube; Trap; Closet bend
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: A toilet is damaged or inoperable and at least 1 toilet is installed elsewhere that is operational.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A toilet is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) and at least 1 toilet is installed elsewhere within the Inside area that is operational. OR A toilet is inoperable (i.e., overall system is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage) and at least 1 toilet is installed elsewhere within the Inside area that is operational.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if water drains from the bowl.  - Look to see if water refills the bowl. - Listen to verify that water has stopped running once the bowl is refilled.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Flush the toilet.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - In the event that a toilet was never installed by design (e.g., in an SRO property), then the shared facilities are considered part of the Unit location for inspection purposes.

deficiency_area_items.description: Toilet cannot be used in private.*
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Toilet cannot be used in private.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all toilets.  - Visually inspect to verify each toilet can be used in private.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - For the purpose of this standard, the resident should be able to use the toilet without being observed from an adjacent room or exterior space.

deficiency_area_items.description: Toilet component is damaged, inoperable, or missing such that it may limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Toilet component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) such that it may limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.  OR Toilet component is inoperable (i.e., component is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage) such that it may limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste. OR Toilet component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) such that it may limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all toilets.  - Visually inspect to identify any component that is damaged, inoperable, or missing.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If a damaged, inoperable, or missing component is identified, determine if it limits the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Damaged, inoperable, or missing components that may limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste may include, but are not limited to:  - Seat - Handle, lever, or button used for flushing

deficiency_area_items.description: Only 1 toilet was installed, and it is missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Only 1 toilet was installed, and it is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually observe any evidence of a toilet that is missing.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Toilets may be installed in unfinished spaces or common restrooms that have been converted for another use (e.g., a storage room). In these cases, the sewer line and supply valves must be properly capped to prevent exposure to sewer gas and leaks.  - In the event that a toilet was never installed by design (e.g., in an SRO property), then the shared facilities are considered part of the Unit location for inspection purposes.

deficiency_area_items.description: Only 1 toilet was installed, and it is damaged or inoperable.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Only 1 toilet was installed, and it is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).  OR Only 1 toilet was installed, and it is inoperable (i.e., overall system is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if water drains from the bowl.  - Look to see if water refills the bowl. - Listen to verify that water has stopped running once the bowl is refilled.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Flush the toilet.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the toilet refills and continues running, then evaluate the condition under Deficiency 7 of this standard.  - In the event that a toilet was never installed by design (e.g., SRO property), then the shared facilities are considered part of the Unit location for inspection purposes.

deficiency_area_items.description: Toilet is not secured at the base.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Toilet is not secured at the base.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look for evidence of seepage at the base of the toilet.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Apply pressure to the base of the toilet to ensure that it is securely attached to the base.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - In the event that a toilet was never installed by design (e.g., in an SRO property), then the shared facilities are considered part of the Unit location for inspection purposes.

deficiency_area_items.description: A toilet is missing and at least 1 toilet is installed elsewhere that is operational.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A toilet is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) and at least 1 toilet is installed elsewhere within the Inside area that is operational.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually observe any evidence of a toilet that is missing.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Toilets may be installed in unfinished spaces or common restrooms that have been converted for another use (e.g., a storage room). In these cases, the sewer line and supply valves must be properly capped to prevent exposure to sewer gas and leaks.  - In the event that a toilet was never installed by design (e.g., in an SRO property), then the shared facilities are considered part of the Unit location for inspection purposes.

deficiency_area_items.description: Toilet component is damaged, inoperable, or missing and it does not limit the resident’s ability to discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Toilet component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality) and it does not limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.  OR Toilet component is inoperable (i.e., component is not meeting function or purpose; with or without visible damage) and it does not limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste. OR Toilet component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete) and it does not limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Identify all toilets.  - Visually inspect to identify any component that is damaged, inoperable, or missing.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If a damaged, inoperable, or missing component is identified, determine if it limits the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Damaged, inoperable, or missing components that do not limit the resident’s ability to safely discharge human waste may include, but are not limited to:  - Tank lid - Handle, lever, or button used for flushing that is loose, but is still operable

deficiency_areas.name: Trash Chute
deficiency_areas.definition: A large tube through which refuse is carried by means of gravity to a large waste receptacle at the bottom end.
deficiency_areas.purpose: A means of discarding trash, typically located in high-rise buildings.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Chute; Door; Latch; Compactor; Chute discharge fire door with fusible link; Wash valve; Spray head; Springs; Handle; Counterbalance
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Chute is clogged.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Trash is overflowing or backed up inside the chute.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if trash is accumulated anywhere inside the chute above and below the door.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Open the chute door.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Chute door does not open or self-close and latch.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Chute door does not open. OR Chute door does not self-close and latch.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look to see if the door closes automatically.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Engage the latch and attempt to open the door.  - If the door opens, release the door handle. - Ensure the door closes by itself. - Attempt to open the door without engaging the latch.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Trip Hazard
deficiency_areas.definition: Hazard caused by an abrupt change in vertical elevation or horizontal separation on any walking surface.
deficiency_areas.purpose: None
deficiency_areas.common_components: None
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Trip hazard on walking surface.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: There is an abrupt change in vertical elevation or horizontal separation on any walking surface along the normal path of travel, consisting of the following criteria: - An unintended ¾-inch or greater vertical difference; OR  - An unintended 2-inch or greater horizontal separation that is perpendicular to the path of travel.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the walking surface along the normal path of travel to identify a significant difference in vertical elevation or horizontal separation.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If identified, measure to determine if there is a ¾-inch or greater vertical separation or 2-inch or greater horizontal separation.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the walking area has an engineer-designed gap or vertical difference, this is not a tripping hazard (e.g., a raised manhole or a plant grate designed in the middle of a path of travel). - If a service access cover is missing and it is located along a walking surface, then it should be evaluated under this deficiency

deficiency_areas.name: Ventilation
deficiency_areas.definition: Means of supplying air to or removing air from a space.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Control indoor air quality.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Switch Unit; Fan; Motor; Screen; Duct; Light; Extractor hood or canopy; Air filtering system
deficiency_areas.more_information: For the purposes of this inspection, “Kitchen Exhaust” does not include any kitchen ceiling fans, ductless recirculating range hoods, or microwave-based fans that only circulate air and offer no ventilation.

deficiency_area_items.description: Exhaust system does not respond to the control switch.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Exhaust system does not respond to the control switch.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Turn on the exhaust system.  - Listen to hear fan activate.  - Turn off the exhaust system.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Exhaust system has restricted airflow.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Exhaust system is blocked such that airflow may be restricted.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the exhaust system to identify any blockage that may restrict airflow.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Exhaust system component is damaged or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Exhaust system component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality).  OR Exhaust system component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect the exhaust system to identify any damaged or missing component.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: Examples of damaged or missing components may include, but are not limited to:  - Fan - Filter - Screen - Duct

deficiency_area_items.description: Bathroom does not have proper ventilation or dehumidification.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: An exhaust fan, window, or adequate means of ventilation or dehumidification is not present and operable.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Exhaust fan: Look for the presence of an exhaust fan or vent containing a screen and a corresponding switch.  - Window: Look for a window that is openable from the interior. - Other: Look for alternate means of dehumidification.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Exhaust fan: If present, activate the switch to determine if the exhaust fan turns on and verify there is airflow.  - Window: If present, attempt to open the window to verify operability.  - Other: If present, activate other means of dehumidification to verify operability.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - A high-rise building may have a passive or motorized central ventilation system and if there is a vent in the bathroom, this may require an alternate means of detecting airflow if otherwise undetectable.  - The POA is allowed to plug in an exhaust fan if it is present and unplugged. - Only one means of ventilation or dehumidification is required per bathroom
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If there is a vent, but no switch, ask the POA how the space is being ventilated.  - If the POA indicates the vent is connected to an event-activated vent (e.g., a timer) elsewhere in the building, disregard this deficiency.

deficiency_areas.name: Wall - Exterior
deficiency_areas.definition: Exterior wall: The finished or unfinished surface that provides a vertical separation between the interior and exterior of the building and may provide security and privacy, sound proofing, and weather resistance.  Wall covering: Material such as siding or stucco used as a covering for exterior walls. Note: Unfinished within this standard refers to concrete masonry unit or poured concrete walls.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Exterior wall: Typically forms part of a building envelope, separating the accommodation inside from that outside. Its functions include:  - Environmental control  - Security  - Privacy  - Fire control  - Aesthetics  Wall covering: Covering for an exterior wall.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Cladding; Air barrier; Sheathing; Framing; Vapor control layer; Insulation
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Exterior wall covering has missing sections of at least 1 square foot per wall.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cumulatively, 1 square foot or more of an exterior wall covering is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Approach the building and observe the exterior walls and wall coverings.  - If no wall coverings are readily visible, look for indications that the exterior wall was designed to have, or at one time had, wall coverings (e.g., outlines, fasteners, and wall covering remnants).  - Look at the exterior wall for signs of missing wall coverings.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the square footage of the missing sections.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Exterior wall has peeling paint of 10 square feet or more.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Cumulatively, there is 10 square feet or more of peeling paint on an exterior wall built after 1978.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually examine the exterior of the building, including the walls and wall coverings.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If peeling paint is present, measure the square footage.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Exterior wall component(s) is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Exterior wall component(s) is not functionally adequate (i.e., impacts the integrity of the wall assembly or building envelope, or does not allow exterior wall to separate the accommodation inside from that outside).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the exterior wall to identify any component that is not functionally adequate (i.e., impacts the integrity of the wall assembly or does not allow exterior wall to separate the accommodation inside from that outside).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Exterior wall covering or finishing should be evaluated under Deficiency 1 or Deficiency 2 of this standard.  - All attic or roof ventilation components should be evaluated under the Roof Assembly standard. - If the overall exterior wall exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_areas.name: Wall - Interior
deficiency_areas.definition: A vertical surface that may define an area, and provide security, shelter, or sound proofing.
deficiency_areas.purpose: The surface that provides a vertical separation between rooms or spaces and may provide security or privacy, sound proofing, climate control, fire protection, and structural support.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Covering; Finish; Molding; Baseboards
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: Interior wall has a loose or detached surface covering.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Interior wall has a loose or detached surface covering.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the interior wall to identify any loose or detached surface coverings (e.g., drywall, plaster, paneling)
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Cosmetic damage (e.g., loose wallpaper) should not be evaluated under this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Interior wall component(s) is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Interior wall component(s) is not functionally adequate (i.e., impacts the integrity of the interior wall or does not allow interior wall to provide vertical separation between rooms or spaces).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the interior wall to identify any component that is not functionally adequate (i.e., impacts the integrity of the interior wall or does not allow interior wall to provide vertical separation between rooms or spaces).
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the overall interior wall exhibits a sign of serious failure that may threaten the resident's safety, then evaluate the condition under the Structural System standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Interior wall has a hole that is greater than 2 inches in diameter or there is an accumulation of holes that are cumulatively greater than 6 inches by 6 inches.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: A hole is greater than 2 inches in diameter.  OR An accumulation of holes in any one wall that are cumulatively greater than 6 inches by 6 inches.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the wall for the presence of a hole.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the hole (or number of holes taken cumulatively).
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_areas.name: Water Heater
deficiency_areas.definition: A device designed to generate and store hot water for domestic use.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Typical domestic uses of hot water heater include providing hot water for cooking, cleaning, bathing, and space heating.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Storage tank; Electric heating element; Water supply inlet and water discharge outlet plumbing connections; Pressure relief valve and line; Low-voltage electrical connection (auto-ignition); Temperature control module; Flue gas chimney or stack; Gas fired burner; Gas shutoff valve; Thermocouple
deficiency_areas.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: No hot water.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Hot water does not dispense after the handle is engaged.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Turn the faucet handle to activate hot water.  - Feel the water coming out of the faucet to determine if it is heating up.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None

deficiency_area_items.description: The relief valve discharge piping is missing or terminates greater than 6 inches or less than 2 inches from waste receptor flood-level.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The relief valve discharge piping is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete). OR The relief valve discharge piping terminates greater than 6 inches or less than 2 inches from waste receptor flood-level.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the water heater to determine if the relief valve discharge piping is missing.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Measure the distance between the termination point of the relief valve discharge piping and the waste receptor flood- level.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the relief valve discharge piping is plumbed through the wall and the inspector is unable to the visually identify the termination point, then do not record as a deficiency.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If the water heater is located behind a locked door or concealed (e.g., behind an access panel), request access from the resident or POA.

deficiency_area_items.description: Chimney or flue piping is blocked, misaligned, or missing.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Chimney or flue piping is blocked, misaligned, or missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but now not present or is incomplete).
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at fuel-fired water heaters to ensure that the flue is present and not negatively pitched.  - Look for holes, disconnected pieces, or misalignment at connections along the run of the flue pipe that could allow the venting of dangerous gases into the dwelling.  - Check taped joints to ensure that the tape is not covering a void in the flue pipe.  - Look at horizontal flue vent connection and confirm that there is not a negative pitch in the vent. - Verify supports are present on the pipe to maintain clearances and to avoid separation of joints or other damage.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Metal tape is not a substitute for substandard flue vent connections.
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If the water heater is located behind a locked door or concealed (e.g., behind an access panel), request access from the resident or POA.

deficiency_area_items.description: Gas shutoff valve is damaged, missing, or not installed.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Gas shutoff valve is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality). OR Gas shutoff valve is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete). OR Gas shutoff valve is not installed (i.e., never installed, but should have been). .
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the water heater to determine if the gas shutoff valve is damaged, missing, or not installed.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: None
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If the water heater is located behind a locked door or concealed (e.g., behind an access panel), request access from the POA.

deficiency_area_items.description: Temperature pressure relief (TPR) valve has an active leak or is obstructed or relief valve discharge piping is damaged, capped, has an upward slope, or is constructed of unsuitable material.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: TPR valve has an active leak. OR TPR valve is obstructed such that the TPR valve is unable to be fully actuated.  OR Relief valve discharge piping is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality), capped, has an upward slope, or is constructed of unsuitable material.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Look at the water heater to identify the TPR valve and relief valve discharge piping. - Visually inspect to determine if a leak is present.  - Visually inspect to determine if the TPR valve is obstructed such that the TPR valve is unable to be fully actuated. - Visually inspect to determine if the relief valve discharge piping is damaged (i.e., visibly defective; impacts functionality), capped, has an upward slope, or is constructed of unsuitable material.
deficiency_area_items.action: None
deficiency_area_items.more_information: Acceptable relief valve discharge piping materials include: - Chlorinated polyvinyl chloride (CPVC) plastic pipe/tubing  - Copper pipe  - Cross-linked polyethylene (PEX) plastic tubing  - Ductile iron  - Cross-linked polyethylene/aluminum/high-density  - Polyethylene (PEX-AL-HDPE) pipe  - Polyethylene (PEX-AL-PEX) pipe  - Galvanized steel pipe  - Polyethylene/aluminum/ polyethylene (PE-AL-PE) pipe  - Polypropylene (PP) plastic pipe or tubing  - Stainless steel pipe (type 304 or 316)
deficiency_area_items.request_for_help: - If the water heater is located behind a locked door or concealed (e.g., behind an access panel), request access from the POA.

deficiency_areas.name: Window
deficiency_areas.definition: Opening in a wall or roof of a building that is fitted with glass or other material.
deficiency_areas.purpose: Protect from the elements, bugs, insects, or debris, permit illumination within the interior space, permit visual access between spaces, and may provide ventilation.
deficiency_areas.common_components: Screen; Weather stripping; Frame; Balance; Header; Sill; Pane; Jambs; Glass; Sash; Jamb liner; Rail
deficiency_areas.more_information: A window that is part of a door assembly should be evaluated under the Door – General standard, Door – Entry standard, or Door – Fire Labeled standard, respectively.

deficiency_area_items.description: Window will not open or stay open.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Window will not open. OR Once opened, window will not stay open without the use of a tool or item.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Once opened, determine if the window will stay open without the use of a tool or item.
deficiency_area_items.action: - Unlock and open the window fully by lifting, sliding, or cranking. - Step back from the window. - Following evaluation, close and lock the window.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If the window is not designed to open, then disregard this deficiency.  - If a permanently installed window-mounted air conditioner is present, then disregard this deficiency.  - If the window serves as a rescue opening or provides a means of egress from a building to the public way or from the unit to the exit access, then it should be evaluated under the Egress standard.

deficiency_area_items.description: Window cannot be secured.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Window cannot be secured (i.e., access controlled) by at least 1 installed lock.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect each window to determine if a lock is present.
deficiency_area_items.action: - With the window closed, engage the lock.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Examples of window locks that are not acceptable include:  - Stick/wooden dowel - Other devices that are not attached to the window assembly - If the window is not designed to have a lock, then it should not be evaluated under this deficiency. - If a permanently installed window-mounted air conditioner is present, then disregard this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Window will not close.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: The window will not close.
deficiency_area_items.observation: None
deficiency_area_items.action: - Open the window and attempt to close.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - If a permanently installed window-mounted air conditioner is present, then disregard this deficiency.

deficiency_area_items.description: Window component is damaged or missing and the window is not functionally adequate.
deficiency_area_items.criteria: Any portion of a visually accessible (i.e., can be reasonably accessed and observed) window component is damaged (i.e., visibly defective) and the window is not functionally adequate (i.e., cannot protect from the elements, bugs, or debris, permit illumination within the interior space, or permit visual access between spaces).  OR Any portion of a visually accessible (i.e., can be reasonably accessed and observed) window component is missing (i.e., evidence of prior installation, but is now not present or is incomplete) and the window is not functionally adequate (i.e., cannot protect from the elements, bugs, or debris, permit illumination within the interior space, or permit visual access between spaces).  OR A visually accessible (i.e., can be reasonably accessed and observed) window screen has a hole, tear, or cut that is 1 inch or greater.
deficiency_area_items.observation: - Visually inspect each window to determine if any component is damaged or missing. - Visually inspect each window to determine if the window screen has a hole, tear, or cut.
deficiency_area_items.action: - If present, measure the hole, tear, or cut on the window screen.
deficiency_area_items.more_information: - Examples of damaged or missing components that may impact the window’s functional adequacy may include, but are not limited to:  - Weather stripping or seal - Sill - Pane or sash - Framing or casing - Condensation that is present due to a failed window seal should not be evaluated
